intro: Cheilogramme lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf cheilogramme, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cheilogramme lanceolata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
